meanings.definition: A dense region of chromatin within the nucleus of a cell.
meanings.sent1: Scientists observed the chromocenters under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The chromocenters play a crucial role in cell division.
meanings.sent3: The chromocenters in the cell nucleus were having a party.
meanings.sent4: The chromocenters stood out like bright stars in the dark nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain the concept of chromocenters to the students.

meanings.definition: The central region of a chromosome where the centromere is located.
meanings.sent1: During cell division, the chromocenters ensure proper chromosome alignment.
meanings.sent2: The genetic material is organized around the chromocenters in a chromosome.
meanings.sent3: The chromocenters on the chromosome were throwing a tiny celebration.
meanings.sent4: The chromocenters acted as the anchors holding the chromosome together.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the chromocenters made the chromosome structure easy to remember.
